PH disaster response.name: Post-Disaster Mapping in Brgy. Naalad and Brgy. Tinaan, Naga City, Cebu
PH disaster response.shortDescription: A landslide struck Barangay Naalad and Barangay Tinaan in Naga City, Cebu last September 20, 2018. In order to help and assist the search and rescue team from the Philippines, UP NOAH aims to map out the building footprints in the affected areas.

PH disaster response.name: Typhoon Ompong: Cordillera Region structures
PH disaster response.shortDescription: Typhoon Ompong (Mangkhut) hit the northern areas of the Philippines. Mapping buildings is needed to augment the existing OpenStreetMap data for use in emergency response, damage assessment and spatial analysis

PH disaster response.name: Typhoon Ompong: Isabela Structures 1
PH disaster response.shortDescription: Typhoon Ompong (Mangkhut) is projected to hit the northern areas of the Philippines. Mapping buildings is needed to augment the existing OSM layers.

Disaster Response.name: LAOS - Attapeu Dam Collapse
Disaster Response.shortDescription:
`Validation Please - should be pretty easy, a lot of forest`

Dam under construction in southwestern Laos collapsed on July 23, displacing at least 6,000 people. This OSM mapping task is part of a World Bank effort to provide immediate support to the local government.

Disaster Response.name: Sri Lanka Flood Response 2018 Project 6b
Disaster Response.organisationTag: Disaster Management Centre of Sri Lanka
Disaster Response.shortDescription: Monsoon rains have caused severe flooding in the Kurunagala and Puttalam districts of Sri Lanka. Your help is needed to map these areas so aid agencies can better assist in the recovery.

Disaster Response.name: Mapping roads and buildings in Solai village, Subukia Sub-County
Disaster Response.shortDescription: The aim of this project is to map in details the road network and buildings in Solai village that was swept away by water after a private dam bursts it's walls.

Ebola2018.name: DRC/Bundibugyo District Border Mapping
Ebola2018.shortDescription:
Author: Missing Maps / HOT Uganda
* Requesting organization:  HOT Uganda/UNHCR
### Imagery: Esri World Imagery
The escalation of violence in DRC  has led to 48,105 refugees arriving in Uganda since January 2018. This rapidly developing situation is not helped by the Ebola outbreak in the DRC. It is vital that accurate and up-to-date mapping information is available to allow UNHCR and partners to respond to needs more effectively and efficiently.

null.name: Lake Chad Region
null.shortDescription: This project will focus on the islands of Chad’s Lac region, part of the greater Lake Chad basin.  Multiple overlapping problems have converged to produce one of the world's most complex humanitarian crisis.

SomaliaFloodsMay2018.name: Beledweyne, Somalia - 2018 Flood Crisis Project 01
SomaliaFloodsMay2018.shortDescription:
`Good for new mappers - small task squares`

Increased rainfall since the beginning of April has resulted in a sharp rise in the Shabelle and Juba rivers, leading to severe flooding. Almost 700,000 people have been affected by flooding in riverine and flood-prone areas. There are concerns that the severe flooding will trigger a cholera outbreak.

name: Hurricane Matthew: Leogane
shortDescription:
`Current #HurricaneMatthew Project`

`Next Haiti Project is 2218 above`

- Author: **HOT**
- Requesting organization: **Red Cross**
- Priority: **Urgent**

`Buildings Only`

Hurricane Matthew a category 4 hurricane caused catastrophic damage to western Haiti. Over 2 feet of rain fell, causing flooding, damaging homes and washing away infrastructure. According to reports over 15,000 people have been displaced including destroying almost 4,000 homes. Bridges and roads have been affected including critical links for relief efforts. The government has estimated at least 350,000 people need some kind of assistance after the disaster.

This data will be used for a detailed damage assessment, relief planning, and for future cholera prevention efforts.

name: Hurricane Matthew: Cuba
shortDescription:
`Current Hurricane Matthew Project, please concentrate here!`

- Author: **HOT**
- Requesting organization: **Red Cross**
- Priority: **Urgent**

`Buildings Only`

Hurricane Matthew a category 4 hurricane is likely to hit the western part of Cuba. The storm is projected to cause flooding due to storm surge and torrential rain of over 2 feet in some areas.

This is the first task to map roads and existing villages and towns to enable a detailed risk assessment.

Missing Maps.shortDescription:
- Author: HOT
- Requesting Organization: **Tanzania Development Trust**
- Priority: **High**

Morogoro, Tanzania has a high incidence of extreme poverty, early marriage and Gender Based Violence. NGOs on the ground need better road and residential area data to facilitate their outreach work.

The Missing Maps project aims to map the most vulnerable places in the world (affected by humanitarian crises: disease epidemics, conflict, natural disasters, poverty, environmental crises). Building on HOT's disaster preparedness projects, the Missing Maps tasks facilitate pre-emptive mapping of priority countries to better facilitate disaster response, medical activities and resource allocation when crises occur.

Missing Maps.name: Mapping buildings in Al Azariq, Yemen
Missing Maps.shortDescription: Since March 2015, a Saudi-led coalition has been fighting anti-government Houthi forces, resulting in widespread destruction, bombing and gun battles. Ordinary people in Yemen are bearing the brunt of an increasingly brutal conflict.

Missing Maps.name: Mapping roads in Al Azariq, Yemen
Missing Maps.shortDescription: Since March 2015, a Saudi-led coalition has been fighting anti-government Houthi forces, resulting in widespread destruction, bombing and gun battles. Ordinary people in Yemen are bearing the brunt of an increasingly brutal conflict.

Missing Maps.name: Missing Maps: Residential areas in Sokoto State, Nigeria (1)
Missing Maps.shortDescription: MSF teams working in Sokoto state, northern Nigeria, respond to a variety of different health needs. These include emergency response to disease outbreaks across the area, outreach and specialised surgical care for noma - a gangrenous infection of the mouth and face , care for children under five, etc. Accurate maps of the area will assist the MSF teams with epidemiological analysis, disease surveillance and logistical planning.

Missing Maps.name: Mapping buildings in Qataba, Yemen
Missing Maps.shortDescription: Since March 2015, a Saudi-led coalition has been fighting anti-government Houthi forces, resulting in widespread destruction, bombing and gun battles. Ordinary people in Yemen are bearing the brunt of an increasingly brutal conflict.

Missing Maps.name: Missing Maps: West Harare, Zimbabwe 5/5
Missing Maps.shortDescription: Budiriro and Glenview are two suburbs in Harare that have repeatedly been the epicentres of typhoid outbreaks. The mapping of these neighbourhoods will help MSF to understand the reasons of the recurring outbreaks.

Missing Maps.name: Missing Maps: Mapping waterways and roads in central Burundi (2)
Missing Maps.shortDescription:
`This project is complete, thank you for your magnificent mapping work!`

To understand which places are more vulnerable to malaria, MSF teams are requesting a mapping of waterways in the centre of the country of Burundi.

Missing Maps.name: Neglected tropical diseases in Liberia
Missing Maps.shortDescription: Neglected tropical diseases affect people living in the most remote and inaccessible places so it is crucial to know where everyone is. In Liberia the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM) is providing technical support to the Liberian Ministry of Health and the [AIM Initiative](http://aiminitiative.org/) for active case finding of four neglected tropical diseases.

Malaria Elimination.name: Mapinhane, Mozambique - Vilankulo Bed Net Surveillance Program
Malaria Elimination.shortDescription:
`Great for new mappers - Squares go very fast!`

Peace Corps Mozambique is requesting assistance in creating a basemap of all towns and cities within the district of Vilankulo, Inhambane Province. The finished maps will be used primarily as foundations for mapping mosquito net coverage within each town. Surveys regarding net coverage will be facilitated by local health workers through CommCare's smart phone-driven, paperless survey application. Follow-up distributions of bed nets will use the subsequent survey data and OSM basemap to inform their campaigns.

Rohingyia Crisis.name: Bangladesh Refugee Crisis - Teknaf camp shelters (new area 21)
Rohingyia Crisis.shortDescription: Almost 1 million Rohingya refugees have fled Myanmar for Southeast Bangladesh in the past few months. CartONG is supporting several humanitarian organizations and in particular UNHCR in mapping the camp to support the humanitarian response to the crisis.
